Question 75) In certain places, flies, created in boiled rice, are used as fishing baits. Some creators, however, believe that these larvae appear spontaneously from cooked rice, as recommended by the theory of spontaneous generation.
This theory began to be refuted by scientists in the seventeenth century, from the studies of Redi and Pasteur, who experimentally showed that
A) living beings can be created in the laboratory.
B) Life originated on the planet from microorganisms.
C) The living being comes from the reproduction of another pre-existing living being.
D) Vermiform beings and microorganisms are evolutionarily related.
E) worms and microorganisms are generated by matter existing in the corpses and nutritious broths, respectively.
